data.name: Defend The Temple
data.description:
STORY

Your friend, who can see the future, send you a message that the temple he lives will get attack by robbers soon. He asked you to make an algorithm, that will output the best formation (the one that will defend the temple from robbers most efficiently.) of monks, that live in the temple, to fight the robbers, with the maximum efficiency.

DESCRIPTION AND EXAMPLE

Rules

  1. Only the first monk is attacked.
  2. All monks can attack the first robber.
  3. The same is for robbers.

Example:

Input: [[8, 100, "Martin"], [2, 200, "Bob"], [20, 70, "John"]]

Monk Martin has 100 Health and 8 Power.
Monk Bob has 200 Health and 2 Power.
Monk John has 70 Health and 20 Power.

The best formation is Bob, Martin, and John, because Bob's power per health point is the least.

Your Code Should Return ["Bob", "Martin", "John"]

Some monks have negative power. It means that they can't hurt attackers, but instead they heal them. They are in the formation beacuse they want to help, even if they do the opposite.

Every monk has at least 1 hp

If every monk has the same amount of health their order will be the same as in the input.

For example:

Input:
[[1, 100, "Mercury"], [1, 1000, "John"], [1, 100, "Mike"]]
Output would be:
John, Mercury, Mike.

You get a copy of information about monks. You can edit it however you want.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is my first kata. I hope you will enjoy it.
